My proposal focuses on the unique needs of the district I represent. I look forward to continuing conversations with folks back home and improving upon this draft #ColoradoRECAct https://twitter.com/PoliticsSun/status/1154042804072570880¬†‚Ä¶
More on the proposal here: https://tipton.house.gov/colorado-rec-act¬†‚Ä¶

The #ColoradoRECAct is intended to balance the unique needs and desires of various stakeholders that I have met with in recent years, and I hope to be able to build broad consensus around this bill as it moves through the legislative process.

The draft proposal would:

Conserve pristine wilderness areas in the San Juan and Sange de Cristos by over 70,000 acres

Formally establish the Curecanti National Recreation Area

Enhance recreation opportunities at the Yucca House National Monument by adding 160 acres

Colorado's Third Congressional District is home to some of our nation's most cherished public lands. I look forward to continue the conversations I've held on how to best manage those lands and receiving feedback to improve upon my draft legislation. #ColoradoRECact pic.twitter.com/ieNz1f1PTg

As we celebrate #Apollo50th this weekend, #Colorado is proud of all who have contributed to space exploration over the years. #Colorado made Big News yesterday as the Interior Department formally announced Grand Junction would be the location for the BLM's HQ. This effort was a remarkable display of collaboration, one I was honored to have helped lead on. pic.twitter.com/uFXc4mDHE2

With 99 percent of federal lands in the West, this move is just common sense. Thank you to everyone who helped make this possible!
 https://tipton.house.gov/media/press-releases/rep-tipton-blm-relocation-great-show-collaboration¬†‚Ä¶ pic.twitter.com/R1tlhnC3Yl

Congratulations again to Grand Junction and thank you to everyone who was involved in the process. I am honored to have played a role in making this a reality. https://www.gjsentinel.com/news/western_colorado/team-effort-pays-off-advocates-say-about-headquarters-relocation/article_427c273a-a78e-11e9-be0e-20677ce85d90.html¬†‚Ä¶

From the local county commissioners to the highest levels of the federal government, getting the BLM HQ to Grand Junction was a remarkable example of collaboration. I hope this sets the precedent for how the BLM will continue to operate moving forward.
